title: Fauset and Photo of NAACP Flag - context

content.question: Which of the following best explains how the New Negro movement of the 1920s contextualizes the reference to “suppression of liberty” in Source 1 and the image in Source 2?

choices.label: The New Negro movement funded writing programs at historically Black colleges and universities (HBCUs), the primary providers of postsecondary education to African Americans.
The New Negro movement’s organization and management of the Black press allowed for the distribution of news to African American communities locally and nationally.
The New Negro movement inspired public conversations about race through the political activism and literary creativity that blossomed during the 1920s.
The New Negro movement fostered Black economic advancement and supported community business initiatives through philanthropy.

content.answer: The New Negro movement inspired public conversations about race through the political activism and literary creativity that blossomed during the 1920s.

topic.text: 3.11: The New Negro Movement and the Harlem Renaissance

skill.text: 1.B: Identify and explain the context of a specific event, development, or process.
